H0.text: Radio telescopes are the type of telescopes that collect and focus radio waves from distant objects.

H1.text: Reflecting telescopes are the type of telescopes that collect and focus radio waves from distant objects.

H2.text: Refracting telescopes collect and focus radio waves from distant objects.

H3.text: Space telescopes collect and focus radio waves from distant objects.

A4.text: A radio telescope is a specialized antenna and radio receiver used to detect radio waves from astronomical radio sources in the sky.

A5.text: Since 1965, humans have launched three space-based radio telescopes.

A6.text: Radio telescopes are directional radio antennas that typically employ a large dish to collect radio waves.

A7.text: Radio telescopes are also used to collect microwave radiation, which has the advantage of being able to pass through the atmosphere and interstellar gas and dust clouds.
